name: downbeat
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
lacking in excitement or hope: The actual signing of the treaty was a downbeat affair without any ceremony. Analysts were downbeat about the company's prospects. I thought he'd be really excited, but he seemed kind of downbeat.
Downbeat music is slow and often sounds sad: The music of political protest does not have to be downbeat. I listen mostly to downbeat indie music.
More examplesFewer examplesThe movie lightens the tone of the novel by adding a few jokes and changing the downbeat ending.Some commentators are downbeat about the potential for progress.I'm tired of reading downbeat reports on my generation's prospects for retirement and cluelessness about saving.The new album is downbeat and elegiac, confirming the band's move away from "rock".
